gurmukhi: AMD qhw niRp hY mn AMD dRujoDn BXo bs qwko lK`XY ] pMf ky puqRn ko ihq Taur deIXq hY suK kY duK d`XY ]1007]
transliteration: Andh Tahaa Nrip Hai Man Andh Drujodhan Bhyo Bas Taako Lakhayyai|| Pand Ke Poutran Ko Hit Thaur Daeeyat Hai Soukh Kai Doukh Dayyai||1007||
translation: “There a blind king is under the control of the wicked Duryodhana, bring his new also; they are all giving sufferings instead of comforts to the sons of Pandava.”1007.

gurmukhi: XoN sun kY iqh kI bqIXw kir kY AkRUr pRnwm isDwrXo ] pMQ kI bwq gnau kih lau pg bIc gjwpur ky iqn DwrXo ]
transliteration: Yon Soun Kai Tih Kibateeyaa Kar(i) Kai Akoor Pranaam Sidhdaryo|| Panth Kibaat Gadau Kah(i) Lau Pag Beech Gadaapur Ke Tin Dhdaryo||
translation: Hearing these words, Akrur bowed and started and reached Hastinapur, what mention should I make about the way?

gurmukhi: pRwq Bey niRp bIc sBw kib sXwm khY ieh BwNq aucwrXo ] BUp khI khu mo ibrQw jdubIrih jw ibiD kMs pCwrXo ]1008]
transliteration: Praat Bhae Nrip Beech Sabhaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo|| Bhoop Kahikahu Mo Birthaa Jadoubeerah(i) Jaa Bidh(i) Kans Pachhdaryo||1008||
translation: In the morning, he went to the court of the king, where the king said, “O Akrur ! tell me in what way Krishna overthrew Kansa?”1008.

gurmukhi: bqIXw suin au`qr dyq BXo irp so sB jw ibiD sXwm lrXo ] gj mwr pHwr kY m`ln ko dl Pwr kY kMs so jwie ArXo ]
transliteration: Bateeyaa Soun(i) Outtar Det Bhayo Rip So Sabh Jaa Bidh(i) Syaam Daryo|| Gad Maar Prahaar Kai Mllan Ko Dal Phaar Kai Kans So Jaaedaryo||
translation: Hearing these words, Akrur told all those devices, which were used by Krishna in fighting against his enemies; he also told this how Krishna killing the elephant and overthrowing the group of wrestlers withstood against Kansa;

gurmukhi: qb kMs inkwr kiRpwn krY Aru Fwl smwr kY ju`D krXo ] qb hI hir jU gih kysn qy ptikE DrnI pr mwr frXo ]1009]
transliteration: Tab Kans Nikaar Kridaan Darai Ar(u) Dhaal Samaar Kai Juddh Daryo|| Tab Hihar(i) Joo Gadh Kesan Te Patkio Dharnidar Maar Daryo||1009||
translation: Then Kansa fought, holding his sward and shield and at the same instant Krishna, catching hold of Kansa by his hair, knocked him down on the ground.1009.

gurmukhi: BIKm dRox kiRpwru suq AOr duswsn bIr inhwrXo ] sUrj ko suq BUr sÍw ijn pwrQ pRwq so bYr auqwrXo ]
transliteration: Bheekham Dron Kridaar(u) Sout Aur Dousaasan Beer Nihdaryo|| Sooraj Ko Sout Bhoor Sravaa Jin Paarath Praat So Bair Outdaryo||
translation: Akrur saw Bhishma, Drona, Kripacharya, Ashvathama and also Bhurshrava, the son of Sun-god, who avenged Arjuna;

gurmukhi: rwj dRujoDn mwql so ieh pyKq hI ieh BwNq aucwrXo ] sXwm khw bsudyv khw kih AMig imly mn ko duKu twrXo ]1010]
transliteration: Raaj Drujodhan Maatal So Eh Pekhat Hieh Bhaant Ouchdaryo|| Syaam Kahaa Basudev Kahaa Kah(i) An(i) Mile Man Ko Doukh(u) Tdaryo||1010||
translation: The king Duryodhana, on seeing Akrur, his maternal uncle asked him about the whereabouts of Krishna and Vasudev; with these words, being pleased, he met Akrur.1010.

gurmukhi: rMck bYT sBw niRp kI auT kY jdubIr PuPI pih AwXo ] kuMqI kau dyK hI kib sXwm khY iqn pwien sIs JukwXo ]
transliteration: Ranchak Baith Sabbhaa Nrip Kiouth Kai Jadoubeer Phouphipah(i) Aayo|| Kountikau Dekh Hikahi Syaam Kahai Tin Paain Sees Jhookaayo||
translation: After sitting for a short while in the royal court, Akrur came to the aunt; on seeing Kunti, he bowed down his head;

gurmukhi: pUCq BI kuslY jdubIr hY jw jsu bIc sBY Dir CwXo ] nIky hY sXwm snY bsudyv su dyvkI nIkI sunI suKu pwXo ]1011]
transliteration: Poochhat Bhikouslai Jadoubeer Hai Jaa Jas(u) Beech Sabhai Dhar(i) Chhaado|| Neeke Hai Syaam Sanai Basudev Su Devakineekisounisoukh(u) Paayo||1011||
translation: She asked about the health of Krishna and was pleased to know about the welfare of Vasudev, Devaki and also Krishna, whose approbation had spread throughout the world.1011.

gurmukhi: ieqny mih ibdur Awie gXo soaU pwrQ mwie kY pwien lwgXo ] pUCq BXo jdubIr suKI AkRUr kau qwr smo AnurwgXo ]
transliteration: Itne Maih Bidur Ae Gado Sooo Paarath Maae Kai Paain Laagyo|| Poochhat Bhyo Jadoubeer Soukhiakroor Kau Taar Samo Anuraagyo||
translation: In the meantime Vidura had come; on coming he had touched the feet of the mother of Arjan; he also asked Akrur about Krishna with affection;
